incidents.name: Errors creating Support Center cases

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've identified the issue, and we are working on a fix. Vercel customers should be able to create cases normally while we monitor case operation metrics closely.

We are investigating an issue with creating new Support Center cases.

For affected Enterprise customers, please escalate out to Vercel contacts via Slack or email for support. For Pro and Hobby customers, please use the Vercel Community: https://community.vercel.com/

incidents.name: Web Analytics and Speed insights data not recorded on some projects

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
On some projects, traffic is miscategorised and not recorded on Speed Insights and Web Analytics

incidents.name: Elevated error rates across new deployments and Vercel API

incident_updates.body:
Vercel API errors have been resolved and dashboard access is restored across all regions.

Queued deployments are recovering automatically, but failed deployments may need to be redeployed manually.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are currently investigating reports of elevated errors for new deployments, Vercel API, and Vercel dashboard. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Elevated errors creating deployments with Neon and Supabase integrations

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Deployments using the Supabase integration are now working as expected. We are continuing to work on `Resource provisioning timed out` errors related to the Neon integration.
We've identified a potential root cause in our webhook service affecting the build process. We will continue to provide further updates as we learn more.

We are currently investigating intermittent `Resource provisioning timed out` errors that occur when creating new deployments with the Neon or Supabase integration. Existing deployments are not affected.

incidents.name: Elevated errors loading Vercel Logs and Speed Insights

incident_updates.body:
We received reports of elevated errors loading Vercel Logs and Speed Insights at 21:15 UTC.

A fix was released at 21:25 UTC, and full functionality was restored by 21:38 UTC.

incidents.name: Speed Insights elevated errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The fix has been released, and we're observing recovery in loading Speed Insights data.
The issue has been identified, and a fix is in progress.
We are currently investigating reports of elevated errors loading Speed Insights data.

incidents.name: Elevated Error Rates for Domain Registrations

incident_updates.body: The issue causing elevated error rates for Domain Registrations has been resolved. Domains are now successfully provisioned and available for immediate use. Some payment attempts may not have completed; we will automatically retry those payments later. No action is needed from customers.
We have deployed a fix for the issue affecting Domain Registrations and are currently monitoring the service to ensure stability.
We have identified the cause of the elevated error rates affecting Domain Registrations, and we are currently implementing a fix.

We are currently investigating elevated error rates affecting Domain Registrations. All existing domains, DNS functionality, deployments, and live traffic remain fully operational. We will provide additional updates as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Elevated errors creating deployments

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The fix has been released, and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the issue and are implementing a fix.

We are currently investigating reports of elevated errors during deployment creation. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Domain search and registration are still impacted. We are investigating this issue.

We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Builds and Deployments were Temporarily in a Queued State

incident_updates.body: Builds and deployments were stuck in a queued state between 10:05 to 10:30 UTC. Our team identified the root cause and deployed a fix, and everything is now operating normally.

incidents.name: Builds and Deployments are Currently in a Queued State

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
All builds are stuck in a queued state. Our team is currently investigating this issue. Live deployments are not affected.

incidents.name: Elevated errors serving traffic in dub1 Edge Region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Runtime logs not showing in Dashboard

incident_updates.body: A change was merged to the Vercel dashboard that introduced a bug in the query for runtime logs in some situations. Upon being alerted, the dashboard was rolled back, which restored the ability to see runtime logs. The change was then reverted. Data was still being collected and no logs are missing.

incidents.name: Builds and Deployments are Currently in a Queued State

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have identified the issue and are working to process the backlog of queued builds.
All builds are stuck in a queued state. Our team is currently investigating this issue. Live deployments are not affected.

incidents.name: AI Gateway is unavailable

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have implemented a fix and are seeing no errors as of 20:26 UTC.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
AI Gateway model requests and metadata API calls are unavailable.

incidents.name: Elevated errors for Edge Config

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Some customers are experiencing an elevated rate of HTTP errors for Edge Config.

incidents.name: Intermittent errors affecting APIs and new builds

incident_updates.body: The issue has been fully mitigated, and this incident has been resolved. No action is needed for customers with queued builds.

We are investigating an issue causing intermittent errors from our public APIs and impacting new builds. Existing deployments are not impacted.

incidents.name: Intermittent failures for builds using Secure Compute or Static IPs

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

New deployments that use Secure Compute or Static IPs are currently experiencing intermittent failures. We've identified the issue and are working to resolve this. Users will need to redeploy affected deployments after the issue is resolved. Existing deployments are not affected.

incidents.name: On-Demand Usage Invoices Delayed

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
Issuance of on-demand usage invoices is currently delayed. Were working to resolve this and expect the delayed invoices to be issued within the next 24 hours.

incidents.name: Issues upgrading v0 plans and adding v0 credits

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating an issue where v0 teams are unable to be upgraded to Business or Team plans, and v0 credits are unable to be added.

incidents.name: Major outage on API, Dashboard, and Builds

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The Vercel API has now been fully resolved. We are continuing to monitor the Dashboard performance.
Builds are now being created as expected and are fully resolved.
We continue to work on resolving the Dashboard and API failures.
We have processed a backlog of builds but we are still observing errors initiating new builds. We have determined the root cause and are working on a fix.
We have identified the root cause of build failures and are working on a fix.
We have identified the root cause of the Dashboard degradation, and a fix is being worked on.
Increased Vercel dashboard failures, API failures, and deployment failures. CDN requests are functioning as expected.

incidents.name: Domain details for domains owned by account scopes can't be accessed

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Details for domains belonging to account scopes (https://vercel.com/account/domains) return 404. If changes need to be made, we recommend transferring these domains to a team scope from this dashboard.

incidents.name: AI SDK and Next.js Learn are unable to sign in to Vercel

We're currently investigating an issue where https://ai-sdk.dev/ and https://nextjs.org/learn/dashboard-app are unable to sign in with Vercel.

incidents.name: Delay in builds for deployments

incident_updates.body:
Some customers may have experienced delays in builds for deployments between 10:58 and 12:35 UTC.
These deployments appeared as Queued within the incident window.

incidents.name: Build and Deployment Errors When Creating New Deployments

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Customers are currently unable to create new deployments through the Git integrations, CLI, or API. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this incident.

incidents.name: Elevated Dashboard and API Errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

incidents.name: DNS record updates are delayed for domains using Vercel Nameservers

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

This incident has been resolved, and we continue to monitor our systems closely.

SSL certificates are still being processed for domains recently acquired through Vercel or that switched to Vercel's Nameservers recently.
This incident has been resolved, and we continue to monitor our systems closely.
The issue has been addressed in a few DNS regions. We are working to resolve this issue fully as soon as possible.
We are closely working with our partners to address this issue as soon as possible.
The issue has been identified, and a fix is being implemented.

Vercel is experiencing issues updating DNS records for new domains acquired through our platform, domains that recently switched to Vercel's Nameservers, and new DNS records added to domains that are already using Vercel's Nameservers.

incidents.name: Edge Config Service Degradation

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are currently investigating an issue with elevated errors rates in Edge Config.

incidents.name: User Registration Service Degradation

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are currently experiencing elevated error rates that are affecting our user registration service. Users may encounter difficulties when attempting to sign up for new accounts. Some registration attempts may fail, while others may experience significantly longer processing times than usual.

Our engineering team is actively investigating this issue and working on a resolution. Existing user logins are not affected.

We recommend that users experiencing signup difficulties try again later.

incidents.name: Delay in issuing SSL certificates for new deployments.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Due to a delay in SSL certificate issuance, new deployments are not accessible over HTTPS. Production and preview traffic to existing deployments is not affected.

incidents.name: Increased 5xx errors in Vercel API, vercel.com, and v0.dev

incident_updates.body: We are no longer observing increased errors, and the incident should be resolved. Our team is still monitoring our health metrics closely.
The issue is resolved, and we are currently monitoring our systems.

Production and preview deployments are not affected by this issue.

incidents.name: Reports of queued builds

incident_updates.body: The incident has been resolved. We are still monitoring the status of our build's systems, and related services, closely.
The issue has been identified and resolved, and we're actively monitoring build infrastructure and dependent services.
We have identified the issue, and our engineers are working on a fix.
We are investigating reports of deployments in the "queued" state for new builds. Live traffic is not affected by this issue.

incidents.name: Degraded External API Calls and Edge Config usage

incident_updates.body:
The incident was resolved. During this window (11:14 - 15:16 UTC, depending on regions), some request data, like external API calls, was not recorded due to an internal logging disruption. As a result, requests made during this period will not appear in the dashboard, logs, or analytics APIs.

Application execution was not impacted. The issue only affected the recording of observability and billing data.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are currently investigating reports of missing data for External API Calls chart under Observability tab and Edge Config under Usage and Billing tabs. End-user traffic is not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Pro usage within allocation is incorrectly being reported as an on-demand charge

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Pro usage within the allocation for regionally priced products is currently being displayed as an on-demand charge as part of our recent iteration on the Usage dashboard. This is a display issue only. You wont be charged for usage within your allocation. Were actively working to fix this.

incidents.name: Intermittent Issues Affecting Team Creation and Billing Details Access

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Were investigating increased latency and errors when creating teams and viewing billing details.

incidents.name: GitHub deployments degraded

incident_updates.body: Between 22:58 and 23:33 UTC, an internal service degradation caused deployments triggered by GitHub to not be properly processed. Service has been fully restored, but impacted customers need to re-trigger deployments attempted during this interval.
